NetworkTypeEnum.description:
Network type.
* Management - External cluster and appliance management.
* Intra_Cluster_Management - Management within the cluster.
* Intra_Cluster_Data - Data within the cluster.
* Storage - External data transfer.
* VMotion - Data movement controlled by VMotion.
* File_Mobility - Network for NAS file replication and import control connection.

Values was added in 3.0.0.0: File_Mobility.

NetworkPurposeEnum.description:
Network purpose.
 * ISCSI - Network provides iSCSI connectivity to storage.
 * NVMe_TCP - Network provides NVME over Fabric connectivity to storage using TCP.
 * File_Mobility - Network provides NAS File Replication and Import control connection.
 * External_Replication - Network provides both iSCSI and iBasic replication connectivity.

Was added in version 2.0.0.0.
Values was added in 2.1.0.0: NVMe_TCP.
Values was added in 3.0.0.0: File_Mobility.
Values was added in 4.0.0.0: External_Replication.

IpVersionTypeEnum.description:
IP protocol version. Values are:
* IPv4
* IPv6

NVMeDiscoveryModeEnum.description:
The NVMe-oF specification defines a Discovery mechanism that a host can use to determine the NVMe subsystems that expose namespaces available to the hose.
A CDC is a Centralized Discovery Controller. A discovery controller reports discovery information from registered Direct Discovery controllers (DDC) and Hosts.
CDC is one of the StFS services, located on the Fabric to which the NVMe Clients (NVMe Subsystems/DDCs and Hosts) are registered.
A DDC is a Direct Discovery Controller, located on the Subsystem Port - Storage Interface.
A Host may use CDC (if detected) or DDC (if CDC is not detected) to determine the IO NVMe subsystem ports.
This only applicable to networks that have NVMe_TCP among their purposes.
* Auto_Discovery_CDC - Automatically discover the IP Address of the Centralized Discovery Controller (CDC) using mDNS/DNS-SD. If a CDC is found, the NVMe/TCP Interface will be registered with it.
* Manual_CDC - the CDC IP address is manually set. If a CDC IP address is set, the NVMe/TCP Interface will be registered with it.
* Advertise_DDC - Direct Discovery Controller IP address is advertised using mDNS/DNS-SD and can be discovered by external hosts.
* Auto_Discovery_Disabled - mDNS/DNS-SD is disabled, no attempt will be made to discover CDC, no attempt will be made to register with CDC if one exists, nor will DDC IP address be advertised.

Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

NvmeCdcConnectionStateEnum.description:
Current state of the Centralized Discovery Controller (CDC) connection to the Direct Discovery Controller (DDC).
* Uninitialized - Sending mDNS queries to discover CDC.
* Kickstarting - CDC was discovered (mDNS response was received or CDC was manually configured) and Kickstart Requests was sent towards CDC to initiate connectivity.
* Pending - Kickstart messaging succeeded, pending to connectivity establishment from CDC.
* Established - CDC established connectivity with DDC.

Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

force.description:
Indicates whether to suppress network validation errors.
The option is intended to suppress false errors caused by network environment constraints.

Normally the command will fail with an error when:
- Some of system network ports are in degraded state or have cabling issues,
- System top-of-rack switches have configuration issues leading to network unreachability,
- Network IP addresses have duplicates in the network environment, or network gateway is unreachable.

When force is true, the command will proceed instead.

Caution: Only use this option when you are certain that your requested settings are correct, and that you understand why they are failing at this time, and that you want to apply the settings anyway.
Improper network settings can make the system unreachable for data and management.

network_scale.description: Parameters for the network scale operation.

add_port_ids.description: Unique identifiers of available IP ports to be used in the network.

remove_port_ids.description: Unique identifiers of IP ports to remove from use in the network.

add_purposes_subset.description:
Used to specify the list of purposes to be enabled on the port during scaling. A subset of network purposes must be passed.
If not specified, all purposes valid for the network will be enabled on the port.

Cannot be used with "remove_port_ids" field, if "remove_port_ids" specified - whole network will be unscaled from specified ports.

Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

force.description:
* Indicates whether to suppress network validation errors.
* The option is intended to suppress false errors caused by network environment constraints.

Normally the command will fail with an error when:
* system network ports on top of which IP ports are configured are in degraded state or have cabling issues,
* or network IP addresses applied as a result of network scaling have duplicates in the network environment.

When force is true, the command will proceed instead.

Caution: Only use this option when you are certain, that your requested settings are correct and you understand why they are failing at this time, and you want to apply the settings anyway.
Improper network settings can make the system unreachable for data.

Only current network purposes may be specified.

Caution: Only ip_ports in which selected network is scaled (already part of the network) can be used.

remove_purposes.description:
The list of purposes to be disabled on the specified ports for current network.

Caution: Cannot be used to remove all functionality from ip_port. Use the scaling
operation instead to remove a port from the network completely.

Specify empty string to remove the gateway.

force.description:
Indicates whether to suppress network validation errors.
The option is intended to suppress false errors caused by network environment constraints.

Normally the command will fail with an error when:
- some of system network ports are in degraded state or have cabling issues,
- system top-of-rack switches have configuration issues leading to network unreachability,
- network IP addresses have duplicates in the network environment,
- or network gateway is unreachable.

When force is true, the command will proceed instead.

Caution: Only use this option when you are certain your requested settings are correct and you understand why they are failing at this time, and you want to apply the settings anyway.
Improper network settings can make the system unreachable for data and management.

IpPurposeTypeEnum.description:
Network IP address purpose.
* Mgmt_Cluster_Floating - Floating IP address for external cluster management.
* Mgmt_Appliance_Floating - Floating IP address for external appliance management.
* Mgmt_Node_CoreOS - IP address for external system node management.
* Mgmt_Node_Host - IP address for external ESXi host management.
* ICM_Postgres_Floating - Floating IP address for internal Postgres access within the cluster.
* ICM_Controlpath_Floating - Floating IP address for controlpath on a particular appliance.
* ICM_Cluster_Floating - Floating IP address for management within the cluster.
* ICM_Appliance_Floating - Floating IP address for appliance management within the cluster.
* ICM_Node_CoreOS - IP address for system node management within the cluster.
* Storage_Cluster_Floating - Floating IP address for external iSCSI discovery.
* Storage_Iscsi_Initiator - IP address for ESXi iSCSI initiators.
* Storage_Iscsi_Target - IP address for system iSCSI targets.
* Storage_NVMe_TCP_Port - IP address for NVMe/TCP subsystem ports.
* External_Replication_Iscsi - IP address for External Replication over iSCSI.
* External_Replication - IP address for iSCSI and iBasic replication connectivity.
* ICD_Node - IP address of a node for data within the cluster.
* SDNAS_Cluster_Floating - Floating IP address for SDNAS management within the cluster.
* SDNAS_Node - IP address for SDNAS node management within the cluster.
* SDNAS_Node_Serviceability - IP address for SDNAS node serviceability access within the cluster.
* File_Mobility_Node - IP address for node within file mobility network.
* File_Mobility_Floating - Floating IP address for file mobility network.
* VMotion - vMotion IP address.
* Unused - Unused IP address.
* Storage_Global - This value is no longer used.

Values was added in 2.0.0.0: External_Replication_Iscsi.
Values was added in 2.1.0.0: Storage_NVMe_TCP_Port.
Values was added in 3.0.0.0: ICM_Postgres_Floating, ICM_Controlpath_Floating, File_Mobility_Node, File_Mobility_Floating.
Values was added in 4.0.0.0: External_Replication.
Values was deprecated in 2.0.0.0: Storage_Global.
Values was deprecated in 4.0.0.0: External_Replication_Iscsi.

IpPortUsageEnum.description:
IP port usages.
* Management - Can be used for the public management network.
* ISCSI - Can be used for the public storage network via iSCSI.
* ISCSI_Default - The default IP port used for HA storage access, the storage discovery address, and is the default port for replication on PowerStore X appliances. IP ports tagged with ISCSI_Default may not be removed. This usage is no longer applicable to Power Store T appliances, though it may remain on PowerStore T appliances that have been upgraded from a release where it was used.
* NVMe_TCP - Can be used for the public storage network via NVMe/TCP.
* External_Replication - Can be used for remote system replication or import traffic.
* File_Mobility - Can be used for NAS server file replication.
* File_Data - Can be used for NAS server file interface configuration.
* ICM - Can be used for management within the cluster.
* ICD - Can be used for data within the cluster.

Values was added in 2.1.0.0: NVMe_TCP.
Values was added in 3.0.0.0: File_Mobility, File_Data.
Values was added in 3.5.0.0: ICM, ICD.

id.description: Unique identifier of the IP port.

partner_id.description: Identifier of the IP port that is configured on top of physical Ethernet port or virtual Ethernet port or bond with the same physical location on the other node of the appliance. Partner ports are configured symmetrically for HA and load balancing purposes within the appliance.

target_iqn.description: iSCSI qualified name used by the target configured on top of the IP port initially or as a result of network scaling. If the IP port is not used by an iSCSI connection, this attribute should be empty.

fsn_id.description:
Unique identifier of the FSN on top of which the IP port is configured.
If the IP port is configured on top of an Ethernet frontend-port or a bond, this attribute should be empty.

Was added in version 3.5.0.0.

bond_id.description:
Unique identifier of the bond on top of which the IP port is configured.
If the IP port is configured on top of an Ethernet front-end port or an FSN, this attribute should be empty.

eth_port_id.description:
Unique identifier of the physical Ethernet front-end port on top of which the IP port is configured.
This attribute can be set when the IP port is used by a Unified appliance.
It should be empty if the IP port is used by a Unified+ appliance or if the IP port is configured on top of a bond or an FSN on a Unified appliance.

veth_port_id.description:
Unique identifier of the virtual Ethernet front-end port on top of which the IP port is configured.
This attribute can be set when the IP port is used by a Unified+ appliance.
For a Unified appliance, the value of veth_port_id should be empty.

add_current_usages.description:
Usages to add to the current usages of an IP port. The current usages of an IP port can be extended with external replication, iSCSI or NVMe_TCP if those usages are in the port's list of available usages.
The same settings will be applied to the partner IP port. If both add_current usages and remove_current usages specified in the request, removal will be done firstly, then addition.

remove_current_usages.description:
Usages to remove from the current usages of an IP port. Only External replication, iSCSI or NVMe_TCP usages can be removed.
The same settings will be applied to the partner IP port. If both add_current usages and remove_current usages specified in the request, removal will be done firstly, then addition.

Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

Unique identifier of the network in which IP port usages will be changed name:{name} can be used instead of {id}. For example: 'network_id':'name:network_name'

Alert State Enum with values. Values are:
* ACTIVE
* CLEARED

alert_instance.description:
An alert is a summation of one or more events that need (or needed) attention.
Some events require attention and result in an alert being generated. Other
events can update or clear an alert when the system detects a change in the
condition that needs attention. To deal with an alert, look at the information
about the most recent event included in the alert. In particular, examine the
resource that the alert was generated about (using resource_type and
resource_id or resource_name) as well as the system_impact_l10n and suggested
repair_flow_l10n parameters.

id.description: Unique identifier of the alert.

event_code.description: The event code of the latest event for this alert.

severity.description: Severity of the latest event for this alert.

resource_type.description: Type of the resource instance which generated this alert.

resource_id.description: Unique identifier of the resource instance which generated this alert.

resource_name.description:
Name of the resource instance which generated this alert. 
This property supports case-insensitive filtering.

description_l10n.description: Latest event's description text for this alert.

generated_timestamp.description: Timestamp of the latest event for this alert.

is_acknowledged.description: Whether an alert has been acknowledged.

raised_timestamp.description: Timestamp of the first event for this alert.

cleared_timestamp.description: Timestamp of the event that cleared this alert.

called_home_timestamp.description:
Timestamp when the event resulted in a notification to support (via
Secured Remote Services), if any.

email_sent_timestamp.description: Timestamp when the email was sent for the raised alert, if any.

snmp_sent_timestamp.description:
Timestamp when the SNMP trap was sent for the raised alert, if any.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

acknowledged_timestamp.description: Timestamp when the alert was acknowledged, if any.

events.description:
List of events associated with this alert. 
Filtering on the fields of this embedded resource is not supported.

Properties of a cluster.
Values was added in 2.0.0.0: primary_appliance_id.
Values was deprecated in 2.0.0.0: master_appliance_id.

id.description: The unique identifier of the cluster.

global_id.description: The global unique identifier of the cluster.

name.description: The name of the cluster.

management_address.description: The floating management IP address for the cluster in IPv4 or IPv6 format.

storage_discovery_address.description:
The floating storage discovery IP address for the cluster in IPv4 or IPv6 format.
If multiple storage discovery addresses are configured, this property will be set to 'null'.
In this case the storage network of interest should be used to retrieve the discovery address.

master_appliance_id.description:
The unique identifier of the appliance acting as primary.
Was deprecated in version 2.0.0.0.

primary_appliance_id.description:
The unique identifier of the appliance acting as primary.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

appliance_count.description: Number of appliances configured in this cluster.

physical_mtu.description:
The physical ethernet port (eth_port resource) MTU setting is global
for all ports in the cluster. This is the default MTU setting for IP traffic,
and the upper limit on network-specific MTU settings (network resource),
where this can be overridden for some specific kinds of traffic (management,
data, and vMotion).

is_encryption_enabled.description: Whether or not Data at Rest Encryption is enabled on the cluster.

compatibility_level.description:
The behavioral version of the software version API, and it is used
to ensure the compatibility across potentially different software versions.

state_l10n.description: Localized string corresponding to state.

system_time.description:
Current clock time for the system. System time and all the system reported
times are in UTC (GMT+0:00) format. The system time is controlled via NTP.
It cannot be set directly.

Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

nvm_subsystem_nqn.description:
NVMe Subsystem NQN for cluster. It cannot be set directly.
Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

name.description:
The new name for the cluster. The name can be up to 64 UTF-8 characters
and cannot be an empty string.

physical_mtu.description:
The physical ethernet port (eth_port resource) MTU setting is global
for all ports in the cluster. This is the default MTU setting for IP traffic,
and the upper limit on network-specific MTU settings (network resource),
where this can be overridden for some specific kinds of traffic (management,
data, and vmotion). This value must be in the range 1500-9000.

At least one appliance is required.

ignore_network_warnings.description:
Set to true to ignore network warnings about unreachable external network services discovered while cluster creation.
This can be useful for configuring a system before delivery into the intended deployment environment.
The default is false, and these warnings will cause cluster creation to fail.

The link local address is a dynamically set local IPv4 address.
It is unique to this appliance and is set by Zeroconf. Use the PowerStore
Discovery Tool to get the link local addresses of available PowerStore appliances
on the local subnet.

Physical switch configuration setting during cluster creation.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

name.description: Name of physical switch.

connections.description: Supported connections for a physical switch.

cluster_create_physical_switch_connectio.description:
Physical switch connection configuration setting during cluster creation.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

address.description: Physical switch address in IPv4 or IPv6 or DNS hostname format.

port.description: Port used for connection to switch.

username.description: Username to connect a physical switch for SSH connection method.

ssh_password.description: SSH password to connect a physical switch if SSH connect method is specified.

snmp_community_string.description: SNMPv2 community string, if SNMPv2c connect method is specified.

cluster_create_networks.description:
Network configuration setting during cluster creation.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

prefix_length.description: Network prefix length, used for both IPv4 and IPv6.

gateway.description: Network gateway in IPv4 or IPv6 format, corresponding to the network's IP version.

cluster_mgmt_address.description:
New cluster management IP address in IPv4 or IPv6 format, corresponding to the network's IP version.
This can only be specified only when configuring the management type network.

storage_discovery_address.description:
New storage discovery IP address in IPv4 or IPv6 format, corresponding to the network's IP version.
This can only be specified only when configuring the storage type network.

addresses.description: IP addresses in IPv4 or IPv6 format.

purposes.description:
Purposes of the network. Only applicable to storage networks. Omitting the property is equivalent to providing all applicable purposes, which are: ISCSI, NVMe/TCP. If provided, must include iSCSI to enable the internal host storage access.
Was added in version 2.1.0.0.

cluster_create_vcenters.description:
vCenter configuration setting during cluster creation.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

address.description: IP address of vCenter in IPv4 or IPv6 or hostname format.

username.description: User name to login to vCenter.

password.description: Password to login to vCenter.

is_verify_server_cert.description: Whether or not the connection will be secured with the vCenter SSL certificate.

data_center_id.description:
VMWare ID of the datacenter. This should be specified when creating PowerStoreX cluster to join an existing datacenter.
data_center_name may not also be specified with this.

Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

data_center_name.description:
Name of the data center. This should be specified when creating PowerStoreX cluster in order to create and join a new datacenter in vCenter.
data_center_id may not also be specified with this.
When data_center_create is false, then an existing datacenter will be used if the name matches, otherwise a new one will be created.

data_center_create.description:
Along with data_center_name, indicates an intent to either create or use existing data center by name.

Was added in version 3.0.0.0.
Was deprecated in version 3.0.0.0.

esx_cluster_name.description:
ESXi cluster name.
The default name is "Cluster-" followed by the PowerStore cluster name. This should be specified when creating PowerStore X cluster.

cluster_create_security_config.description:
security configuration setting during cluster creation.
Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

is_http_redirect_enabled.description:
If true, redirecting HTTP requests to HTTPS is enabled. If false, HTTP redirection is disabled and only HTTPS is allowed.
Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

vasa_retain_certificate.description:
If true, VASA server certificate will not be overwritten by the vCenter.
Was added in version 3.5.0.0.

cluster_create_vasa_provider_credentials.description:
Storage system credentials for vCenter to use for communicating with the storage system using VASA.
Parameters are required when creating PowerStore X cluster and optional for PowerStore cluster.

Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

username.description: Username of the local user account which will be used by vSphere to register VASA provider.

password.description: Password of the local user account which will be used by vSphere to register VASA provider.

cluster_validate_create.description:
Validate create cluster parameters.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

appliances.description:
The configuration settings for adding appliances during cluster creation.
At least one appliance is required.

items.description:
DNS server addresses in IPv4 or IPv6 format. At least one DNS server
should be provided.

NTP server addresses in IPv4 or IPv6 or hostname format. At least one
NTP server should be provided.

physical_switches.description: Create physical switch settings for a cluster.

networks.description: Configuration of one or more network(s) based on network type

vcenters.description:
Configure vCenter settings when creating cluster. Parameters are required
when creating PowerStore X cluster and optional for PowerStore cluster.
 * Note - currently only single element is supported.

cluster_validate_create_response.description:
Response for a validate create request. It returns configuration warnings
and errors detected during validation, as well as suggested resolutions.

Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

cluster_create_error_response.description:
Error response for create operation. Contains a list of localized messages and a list of validation issues accompanied by the suggested resolution.

Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

cluster_discover_fc_targets_response.description:
Response from the cluster discover_fc_targets operation.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

fc_targets.description:
FC target addresses for the data connection to the remote system.
Must be specified when creating a Generic remote system.

cluster_validate_expand_response.description:
Response for a validate expand request. It returns configuration issues
detected for cluster expansion.

Was added in version 4.1.0.0.

expansion_issues.description: A list of configuration issues that block cluster expansion.

cluster_validate_expand_issue.description:
The cluster expansion issue information that contains an expansion issue type and a reason.
Was added in version 4.1.0.0.

issue_type_l10n.description:
Localized message string corresponding to issue_type
Was added in version 4.1.0.0.

ClusterExpansionIssueEnum.description:
Possible expansion issues for the cluster.
* Cluster_Size_Limit_Reached - Cluster size limit has reached.
* Stig_Enabled - STIG is enabled on cluster.
* Primary_Appliance_4PortCard_Not_Available - Failed to find 4-Port card on cluster primary appliance.

Was added in version 4.1.0.0.

metrics_generate_response.description: Response will be just an array of one of the child of this definition

entity.description: Localized message string corresponding to entity.

entity_l10n.description: Localized message string corresponding to entity

MetricsEntityEnum.description:
An enum describing the various entities supported by metrics.
  * performance_metrics_by_appliance - Appliance performance metrics.
  * performance_metrics_by_node - Node performance metrics.
  * performance_metrics_by_volume - Volume performance metrics.
  * performance_metrics_by_cluster - Cluster performance metrics.
  * performance_metrics_by_vm - Virtual Machine performance metrics.
  * performance_metrics_by_vg - Storage performance metrics for all volumes in a volume group
  * performance_metrics_by_fe_fc_port - Frontend fibre channel port performance metrics.
  * performance_metrics_by_fe_eth_port - Frontend ethernet port performance metrics.
  * performance_metrics_by_fe_eth_node - Frontend ethernet performance metrics for node.
  * performance_metrics_by_fe_fc_node - Frontend fibre channel performance metrics for node.
  * vsphere_metrics_by_vm - Virtual Machine performance metrics directly from vSphere.
  * vsphere_appson_metrics_by_node - Usage of CPU/Memory resources on the node by user Virtual machines.
  * vsphere_appson_metrics_by_appliance - Usage of CPU/Memory resources on the appliance by user Virtual machines.
  * wear_metrics_by_drive - Drive wear metrics.
  * wear_metrics_by_drive_daily
  * space_metrics_by_cluster - Cluster space metrics
  * space_metrics_by_appliance - Appliance space metrics
  * space_metrics_by_volume - Volume space metrics
  * space_metrics_by_volume_family - Volume family space metrics
  * space_metrics_by_vm - Virtual Machine space metrics
  * space_metrics_by_storage_container - Storage Container space metrics
  * space_metrics_by_vg - Volume space metrics in a volume group
  * copy_metrics_by_appliance - Appliance copy metrics
  * copy_metrics_by_cluster - Cluster copy metrics
  * copy_metrics_by_vg - Copy metrics for each volume group
  * copy_metrics_by_rg - Copy metrics for each replication group
  * copy_metrics_by_remote_system - Copy metrics for each remote system
  * copy_metrics_by_replication_session - Copy metrics for each replication session
  * copy_metrics_by_volume - Copy metrics for each volume
  * performance_metrics_by_file_system - Performance metrics for the file system.
  * performance_metrics_smb_by_node - Performance metrics for the SMB protocol global
  * performance_metrics_smb_builtinclient_by_node - Performance metrics for the SMB protocol built-in client
  * performance_metrics_smb_branch_cache_by_node - Performance metrics for the SMB protocol Branch-Cache
  * performance_metrics_smb1_by_node - Performance metrics for the SMB1 protocol basic
  * performance_metrics_smb1_builtinclient_by_node - Performance metrics for the SMB1 protocol built-in client
  * performance_metrics_smb2_by_node - Performance metrics for the SMB2 protocol basic
  * performance_metrics_smb2_builtinclient_by_node - Performance metrics for the SMB2 protocol built-in client
  * performance_metrics_nfs_by_node - Performance metrics for the NFS protocol
  * performance_metrics_nfsv3_by_node - Performance metrics for the NFSv3 protocol
  * performance_metrics_nfsv4_by_node - Performance metrics for the NFSv4 protocol
  * performance_metrics_file_by_node - Performance metrics for file by node.
  * performance_metrics_file_by_appliance - Performance metrics for file by appliance.
  * performance_metrics_file_by_cluster - Performance metrics for file by cluster.
  * performance_metrics_by_ip_port - Performance metrics for the ip port (total)
  * performance_metrics_by_ip_port_iscsi - Performance metrics for the ip port (iSCSI)
  * performance_metrics_by_nas_server - Performance metrics for the Nas Server
  * space_metrics_by_file_system - Space metrics for the File System.
  * performance_metrics_by_initiator - Performance metrics for the initiator
  * performance_metrics_by_host - Performance metrics for the host
  * performance_metrics_by_hg - Performance metrics for all hosts in a host group
  * space_metrics_by_remote_system - Remote system space metrics. Currently this is supported only for the PowerProtect DD remote systems.
  * copy_metrics_by_file_system - Copy metrics for each file system
  * copy_metrics_by_nas_server - Copy metrics for each nas server
  * performance_headroom_by_appliance - Appliance performance headroom metrics
  * performance_metrics_by_appliance_resource_util - Appliance hardware resource utilization metrics

Values was deprecated in 2.0.0.0: wear_metrics_by_drive.
Values was added in 2.0.0.0: performance_metrics_by_ip_port, performance_metrics_file_by_node, performance_metrics_file_by_appliance, performance_metrics_file_by_cluster.
Values was added in 3.0.0.0: performance_metrics_by_nas_server, space_metrics_by_file_system, performance_metrics_by_initiator, performance_metrics_by_host, performance_metrics_by_hg, vsphere_metrics_by_vm, vsphere_appson_metrics_by_node, vsphere_appson_metrics_by_appliance, copy_metrics_by_rg, performance_metrics_by_ip_port_iscsi.
Values was added in 3.5.0.0: space_metrics_by_remote_system.
Values was added in 4.0.0.0: copy_metrics_by_file_system, copy_metrics_by_nas_server.
Values was added in 4.1.0.0: performance_headroom_by_appliance, performance_metrics_by_appliance_resource_util, copy_metrics_by_replication_session.

MetricsIntervalEnum.description:
Intervals of which metrics can be provided. Values are:
* Best_Available
* Five_Sec
* Twenty_Sec
* Five_Mins
* One_Hour
* One_Day

Values was added in 3.0.0.0: Best_Available, Five_Sec.

PerformanceBottleneckEnum.description:
Potential performance bottleneck components when performance headroom limit is reached.
When performance headroom is 20% or less, HW components with saturation 70% or higher are potential
performance bottlenecks.
When performance headroom is greater than 20% performance bottlenecks are not reported.
Performance bottleneck values are:
* CPU - CPU cores used by frontend and IO processing software
* FE_Port - Frontend port
* Backend - Backend device
* Log_Media - Persistent log media

Was added in version 4.1.0.0.

x-display_enum_text.CPU: CPU cores used by frontend and IO processing software

space_metrics_by_cluster.description: Space metrics for the cluster collected at five minute interval.

space_metrics_by_cluster_rollup.description: Summary of cluster level space metric data for a specific period of time, beginning with timestamp, including the maximum and final values for that period. Current support is for a time period of one hour and one day.

space_metrics_by_appliance.description: Space metrics for the appliance collected at five minute interval.

space_metrics_by_appliance_rollup.description: Summary of appliance level space metric data for a specific period of time, beginning with timestamp and including the maximum and final values for that period. Current support is for a time period of one hour and one day.

space_metrics_by_volume.description: Space metrics for the volume collected at five minute interval.

base_space_metrics_by_cluster.description: Space metrics for the cluster collected at five minute interval.

logical_provisioned.description: Total configured size of all storage ojects within the cluster. This metric includes all primaries, snaps and clones.

logical_used.description: Amount of data in bytes written to all storage objects within the cluster, without any deduplication and/or compression. This metric includes all primaries, snaps and clones.

logical_used_volume.description:
Amount of data in bytes written to all block volumes within the cluster, without any deduplication and/or compression. This metric includes all primaries, snaps and clones.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

logical_used_file_system.description:
Amount of data in bytes written to all file systems within the cluster, without any deduplication and/or compression. This metric includes all primaries, snaps and clones.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

logical_used_vvol.description:
Amount of data in bytes written to all virtual volumes within the cluster, without any deduplication and/or compression. This metric includes all primaries, snaps and clones.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

shared_logical_used_volume.description:
Amount of data in bytes written to all block volumes on an appliance, without any deduplication and/or compression. This metric includes all primaries and clones.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

shared_logical_used_file_system.description:
Amount of data in bytes written to all file systems on an appliance, without any deduplication and/or compression. This metric includes all primaries and clones.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

shared_logical_used_vvol.description:
Amount of data in bytes written to all virtual volumes on an appliance, without any deduplication and/or compression. This metric includes all primaries and clones.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

physical_total.description: The total combined space on the physical drives of the cluster available for data.

physical_used.description: The total physical space consumed in the cluster, accounting for all efficiency mechanisms, as well as all data protection.

data_physical_used.description: This metric represents total amount of physical space user data occupies after deduplication and compression.

efficiency_ratio.description: The overall efficiency is computed as a ratio of the total space provisioned to physical used space. For example, ten 2 GB volumes were provisioned and 1 GB of data is written to each of them. Each of the volumes has one snapshot as well, for another ten 2 GB volumes. All volumes are thinly provisioned with deduplication and compression applied, there is 4 GB of physical space used. Overall efficiency would be (20 * 2 GB) / 4 GB or 10:1. The efficiency_ratio value will be 10 in this example.

data_reduction.description: Ratio of the logical used space to data physical used space which is after deduplication and compression.

snapshot_savings.description: Ratio of the amount of space that would have been used by snapshots if space efficiency was not applied to logical space used solely by snapshots. For example, an object is provisioned as 1 GB and it has two snapshots. Each snapshot has 200 MB of data. Snapshot savings will be (1 GB + 1 GB) / (0.2 GB + 0.2 GB) or 5:1. The snapshot_savings value will be 5 in this case.

thin_savings.description: Ratio of all the vVol provisioned to data they contain. This is the ratio of logical_provisioned to logical_used. For example, a cluster has two 2 GB objects and have written 500 MB bytes of data to them. The thin savings would be (2 * 2 GB) / (2 * 0.5 GB) or 4:1, so the thin_savings value would be 4.0.

shared_logical_used.description: Cluster shared logical used is sum of appliances' shared logical used in the cluster.

system_free_space.description:
Space formerly used by the system for internal needs that will be reused for the same purpose as additional storage is provisioned.
Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

unreducible_data.description:
Amount of data that cannot be compressed or deduped. A null value indicates insufficient data to calculate the unreducible data.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

reducible_data_reduction.description:
Ratio of the logical used space to data physical used space which is after deduplication and compression, based on reducible data only.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

repeat_count.description: Number of times the metrics are repeated.

All volumes are thinly provisioned with deduplication and compression applied, there is 4 GB of physical space used. Overall efficiency would be (20 * 2 GB) / 4 GB or 10:1. data_reduction.description: Ratio of the logical used space to data physical used space which is after deduplication and compression.

logical_used.description: Amount of data in bytes host has written to a volume without any deduplication, compression or sharing. This metric includes primaries, snaps and clones.

thin_savings.description: Ratio of all the volumes provisioned to data being written to them. For example, an appliance has two 2 GB volumes and have written 500 MB of data to them. The thin savings would be (2 GB * 2) / (0.5 GB * 2) or 4:1, so the thin_savings value would be 4.0.

base_space_metrics_by_vm.description: Space metrics for the VM collected at five minute interval.

vm_id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific virtual machine.

logical_provisioned.description: Total configured size in bytes of all virtual volumes used by virtual machine.

logical_used.description: Total amount of data in bytes written to all virtual volumes used by virtual machine.

unique_physical_used.description: Amount of physical space virtual machine used after compression and deduplication. This is the space to be freed up if a virtual machine is removed.

snap_clone_logical_used.description: Total amount of data in bytes host has written to all volumes used by virtual machine without any deduplication, compression or sharing. This metric includes snaps and clones in the volume family used by virtual machine.

thin_savings.description: Ratio of all the vVol provisioned to data they contain. This is the ratio of logical_provisioned to logical_used. For example, a VM has two 2 GB vVol's and have written 500 MB of data to them. The thin savings would be (2 * 2GB) / (2 * 0.5 GB) or 4:1, so the thin_savings value would be 4.0.

snapshot_savings.description: Ratio of the amount of space that would have been used by snapshots if space efficiency was not applied to logical space used solely by snapshots of vVols used by virtual machine. For example, a vVol is provisioned as 1 GB and it has two snapshots. Each snapshot has 200 MB of data. Snapshot savings will be (1 GB + 1 GB) / (0.2 GB + 0.2 GB) or 5:1. The snapshot_savings value will be 5 in this case.

shared_logical_used.description:
Amount of space the virtual machine needs to hold the data written by host and shared by snaps and fast-clones in their families. This does not include deduplication or compression.
Was added in version 3.5.0.0.

unreducible_data.description:
Amount of data that cannot be compressed or deduped. A null value indicates insufficient data to calculate the unreducible data.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

data_reduction.description:
Ratio of the logical used space to data physical used space which is after deduplication and compression.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

reducible_data_reduction.description:
Ratio of the logical used space to data physical used space which is after deduplication and compression, based on reducible data only.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

repeat_count.description: Number of times the metrics are repeated.

base_space_metrics_by_volume_family.description: Space metrics for the volume family collected at five minute interval.

appliance_id.description: Reference to the associated appliance on which these metrics were recorded.

logical_provisioned.description: Configured size in bytes of a volume which amount of data can be written to. This metric includes primaries, snaps and clones.

logical_used.description: Amount of data in bytes host has written to a volume family without any deduplication, compression or sharing. This metric includes primaries, snaps and clones.

shared_logical_used.description: Amount of space the volume family needs to hold the data written by host and shared by snaps and fast-clones in the family. This does not include deduplication or compression.

unique_physical_used.description: Amount of physical space volume family used after compression and deduplication. This is the space to be freed up if a volume family is removed from the appliance.

snap_clone_logical_used.description: Total Amount of data in bytes host has written to all volumes in the volume family without any deduplication, compression or sharing. This metric includes snaps and clones in the volume family.

snapshot_savings.description: Ratio of the amount of space that would have been used by snapshots if space efficiency was not applied to logical space used solely by snapshots. For example, a volume is provisioned as 1 GB bytes and it has two snapshots. Each snapshot has 200 MB of data. Snapshot savings will be (1 GB + 1 GB) / (0.2 GB + 0.2 GB) or 5:1. The snapshot_savings value will be 5 in this case.

unreducible_data.description:
Amount of data that cannot be compressed or deduped. A null value indicates insufficient data to calculate the unreducible data.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

data_reduction.description:
Ratio of the logical used space to data physical used space which is after deduplication and compression.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

reducible_data_reduction.description:
Ratio of the logical used space to data physical used space which is after deduplication and compression, based on reducible data only.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

repeat_count.description: Number of times the metrics are repeated.

base_space_metrics_by_vg.description: Space metrics for a volume group collected at a five minute interval.

vg_id.description: Unique identifier representing a volume group.

logical_provisioned.description: Total configured size in bytes of all member volumes in a volume group.

logical_used.description: Total amount of data in bytes written to all member volumes in a volume group.

snap_clone_logical_used.description: Total amount of data in bytes host has written to all volumes in the volume group without any deduplication, compression or sharing. This metric includes used snaps and clones in the volume group.

thin_savings.description: Ratio of all the volumes provisioned to data being written to them. For example, a volume group has two 2 GB volumes and have written 500 MB of data to them. The thin savings would be (2 * 2 GB) / (2 * 0.5 GB) or 4:1, so the thin_savings value would be 4.0.

snapshot_savings.description: Ratio of the amount of space that would have been used by snapshots in the volume group if space efficiency was not applied to logical space used solely by snapshots. For example, two volumes are provisioned as 1 GB and each has two snapshots. Each snapshot has 200 MB of data. Snapshot savings will be (1 GB * 2 + 1 GB * 2) / (0.2 GB * 2 + 0.2 GB * 2) or 5:1. The snapshot_savings value will be 5 in this case.

shared_logical_used.description:
Amount of space the volume group needs to hold the data written by host and shared by snaps and fast-clones in their families. This does not include deduplication or compression.
Was added in version 3.5.0.0.

unique_physical_used.description:
Amount of physical space volume group used after compression and deduplication. This is the space to be freed up if a volume group is removed.
Was added in version 3.5.0.0.

unreducible_data.description:
Amount of data that cannot be compressed or deduped. A null value indicates insufficient data to calculate the unreducible data.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

data_reduction.description:
Ratio of the logical used space to data physical used space which is after deduplication and compression.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

reducible_data_reduction.description:
Ratio of the logical used space to data physical used space which is after deduplication and compression, based on reducible data only.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

repeat_count.description: Number of times the metrics are repeated.

avg_mirror_overhead_latency.description:

base_space_metrics_by_storage_container.description: Space metrics of storage container aggregated from all appliances collected at five minute interval.

storage_container_id.description: Internal ID of the storage container.

logical_provisioned.description: Total configured size in bytes of the primary and clone virtual volumes within the storage container.

logical_used.description: Amount of data in bytes written to primary and clone virtual volumes within the storage container.

shared_logical_used.description:
Amount of space the storage container needs to hold the data written by host and shared by snaps and fast-clones in their families; this does not include deduplication or compression.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

snapshot_savings.description: Ratio of the amount of space that would have been used by snapshots if space efficiency was not applied to logical space used solely by snapshots. For example, a volume is provisioned as 1 GB and it has two snapshots. Each snapshot has 200 MB of data. Snapshot savings will be (1 GB + 1 GB) / (0.2 GB + 0.2 GB) or 5:1. The snapshot_savings value will be 5 in this case.

unique_physical_used.description:
Amount of physical space storage container used after compression and deduplication. This is the space to be freed up if a storage container is removed.
Was added in version 3.5.0.0.

snap_clone_logical_used.description:
Total amount of data in bytes host has written to all volumes used by storage container without any deduplication, compression or sharing. This metric includes snaps and clones in the volume family used by storage container.
Was added in version 3.5.0.0.

thin_savings.description:
Ratio of all the vVol provisioned to data they contain. This is the ratio of logical_provisioned to logical_used. For example, a SC has two 2 GB vVol's and have written 500 MB of data to them. The thin savings would be (2 * 2GB) / (2 * 0.5 GB) or 4:1, so the thin_savings value would be 4.0.
Was added in version 3.5.0.0.

unreducible_data.description:
Amount of data that cannot be compressed or deduped. A null value indicates insufficient data to calculate the unreducible data.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

data_reduction.description:
Ratio of the logical used space to data physical used space which is after deduplication and compression.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

reducible_data_reduction.description:
Ratio of the logical used space to data physical used space which is after deduplication and compression, based on reducible data only.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

base_performance_headroom_by_appliance.description:
Describes performance headroom for an appliance at a specified time based on IO workload pattern
observed over last 24 hours. Headroom (unutilized performance capabilities of a system) is calculated
using resource utilization of IO processing hardware components such as FE port, CPU, Backend and NVRAM.
Using headroom, max. sustainable IOPS at equivalent const. workload and increment in current workload
pattern are calculated.
max_sustainable_iops_at_const_workload =
  avg_total_iops * (100/(100 - headroom)) incr_current_workload_pattern
  = ((100/(100 - headroom)) - 1) * 100
Performance headroom is available only at one day interval.

Was added in version 4.1.0.0.

appliance_id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific appliance.

effective_cpu_core_util.description: Effective CPU core utilization based on CPU core utilization and ability of the current software to utilize CPU cores efficiently by IO workload running for last 24 hours.

max_fe_cpu_core_util.description: Maximum CPU core utilization by frontend when processing IO workload for last 24 hours.

max_file_cpu_core_util.description: Maximum CPU core utilization when processing file IO workload for last 24 hours.

max_cpu_core_util.description: Maximum CPU core utilization by frontend and IO processing software. It is the maximum of effective_cpu_core_util, max_fe_cpu_core_util and max_file_cpu_core_util when processing IO workload for last 24 hours.

max_fe_port_util.description: Maximum frontend port resources utilized by IO workload pattern running for last 24 hours.

max_backend_util.description: Maximum backend resources utilized by IO workload pattern running for last 24 hours.

max_log_media_util.description: Maximum log media utilization by IO workload pattern running for last 24 hours.

headroom.description: Unutilized performance capabilities (expressed as a percent of total performance capabilities) based on IO workload pattern running on a system for last 24 hours.

incr_current_workload_pattern.description: Allowable percent increment in current workload pattern based on available headroom.

avg_total_iops.description: Average total IOPS of IO workload pattern running for last 24 hours.

avg_latency.description: Average read and write latency in microseconds.

max_sustainable_iops_at_const_workload.description: Maximum sustainable IOPS of equivalent constant workload running over last 24 hours. Exceeding the max. sustainable IOPS limit may result in performance degradation.

recommended_max_sustainable_iops_at_cons.description: Recommended max. sustainable IOPS of equivalent constant workload running over last 24 hours. It is a recommended constant rate workload IOPS limit up to which the system is expected to provide a reasonable io performance.

storage_container_instance.description:
A storage container is a logical grouping of related storage objects.  For
example, a storage container maps to a vVol datastore in vSphere where the
storage for virtual machines can be provisioned.

This resource type has queriable associations from virtual_volume, replication_group, datastore, storage_container_destination

id.description: The unique identifier of the storage container.

name.description:
Name for the storage container. This should be unique across all
storage containers in the cluster. Name can be from 1 to 64 UTF-8
characters, and not more than 127 bytes. Name cannot contain characters '/', '\', '%', '“'.
 
This property supports case-insensitive filtering.

quota.description:
The total number of bytes that can be provisioned/reserved against
this storage container.  A value of 0 means there is no limit. It is
possible to set the quota to a value that overprovisions the amount of
space available in the system.

storage_protocol_l10n.description:
Localized message string corresponding to storage_protocol
Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

virtual_volumes.description: This is the inverse of the resource type virtual_volume association.

replication_groups.description: This is the inverse of the resource type replication_group association.

datastores.description: This is the inverse of the resource type datastore association.

destinations.description: This is the inverse of the resource type storage_container_destination association.

StorageContainerStorageProtocolEnum.description:
The type of Storage Container.
* SCSI - A storage container is dedicated to SCSI usage.
* NVMe - A storage container is dedicated to NVMe usage.

Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

name.description:
Name for the storage container that is unique across all storage
containers in the cluster. The name must be between 1 and 64 UTF-8
characters (inclusive), and not more than 127 bytes.
Name cannot contain characters '/', '\', '%', '“', '[', ']'.

quota.description:
The number of bytes that can be provisioned against this storage
container. This must be a value greater than 10Gb and the default is 0
which means no limit.

high_water_mark.description:
This is the percentage of the quota that can be consumed before an alert is raised.
Values between 50-100 (inclusive) are allowed.

Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

mount.description:
If specified, performs mount a storage container in vCenter operation as part of create operation.
Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

datastore_name.description:
This will be the VVol datastore name in vCenter when it is mounted.
If not specified, the name of a storage container is used.
datastore_name cannot contain characters '/', '\', '%', '“', '[', ']'.

Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

vsphere_host_ids.description:
Unique identifiers of the vsphere_host instances used to mount VVol datastore in vCenter.
Parameter is required for mounting storage container in Power Store case,
if not specified for Power Store X case, Power Store X cluster hosts are used.

Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

items.description: name:{name} can be used instead of {id}. For example: 'vsphere_host_ids':['name:vsphere_host_name']

unmount.description:
If specified, performs unmount of a storage container as a part of delete operation.

Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

force.description:
Normally, deletion of a storage container that still contains virtual volumes will be rejected.
This option overrides that error and allows the delete to continue. Use with
great caution.

name.description:
New name for the storage container that is unique across
all storage containers in the cluster. The name must be between
1 and 64 UTF-8 characters (inclusive), and not more than 127 bytes.
Name cannot contain characters '/', '\', '%', '“', '[', ']'.

quota.description:
The number of bytes that can be provisioned against this storage
container. It cannot be set lower than the current used space or 10Gb.
A value of 0 means unlimited.

datastore_name.description:
This will be the VVol datastore name in vCenter when it is mounted. If not specified,
the name of a storage container is used. datastore_name cannot contain
characters '/', '\', '%', '“', '[', ']'.

vsphere_host_ids.description:
Unique identifiers of the vsphere_host instances used to mount VVol datastore in vCenter.
Parameter is required for mounting storage container in Power Store case,
if not specified for Power Store X case, Power Store X cluster hosts are used.

Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

items.description: name:{name} can be used instead of {id}. For example: 'vsphere_host_ids':['name:vsphere_host_name']

IoPriorityEnum.description:
The I/O priority for quality of service rules. Values are:
* Low
* Medium
* High

virtual_volume_instance.description:
A virtual volume.
This resource type has queriable associations from appliance, storage_container, replication_group, migration_session, virtual_volume, policy, host_virtual_volume_mapping, virtual_machine

id.description: The unique identifier of the virtual volume.

name.description:
The name of the virtual volume, based on metadata provided by vSphere.
 
This property supports case-insensitive filtering.

size.description: The size of the virtual volume in bytes.

appliance_id.description: The appliance where the virtual volume resides.

storage_container_id.description: The storage container where the virtual volume resides.

profile_id.description: The ID of the storage profile governing this virtual volume.

replication_group_id.description:
The unique identifier of the replication group object that this virtual volume belongs to.
Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

is_readonly.description: Indicates whether the virtual volume is read-only.

migration_session_id.description: If the virtual volume is part of a migration activity, the session ID for that migration.

virtual_machine_uuid.description: UUID of the virtual machine that owns this virtual volume.

family_id.description:
Family id of the virtual volume. This is the id of the primary object at the root of the family tree.
For a primary virtual volume this will be the same as the id of the object.
For snap-sets and clone vVols it will be set to the source objects family ID.

parent_id.description:
For snapshots and clones, the ID of the parent virtual volume. The parent_id is set when an
virtual volume is created and will only change if its parent virtual volume is deleted.

source_id.description:
Id of the virtual volume from which the content has been sourced. Data is sourced from another
virtual volume when a snapshot or clone is created, or when a refresh or restore occurs.
Only applies to snap and clones.

source_timestamp.description: The source data time-stamp of the virtual volume.

creation_timestamp.description: Timestamp of the moment virtual volume was created at.

naa_name.description:
The NAA name used by hosts for I/O.  This is the VASA equivalent of a LUN's WWN.
Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

is_replication_destination.description:
Indicates whether virtual volume is replication destination or not.
Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

location_history.description: Filtering on the fields of this embedded resource is not supported.

protection_policy_id.description:
The unique identifier of the protection policy applied to this virtual volume.
Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

nsid.description:
NVMe Namespace unique identifier in the NVMe subsystem.
Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

nguid.description:
NVMe Namespace globally unique identifier.
Was added in version 3.0.0.0.

The logical type of a virtual volume. Values are:
* Primary
* Snapshot
* Prepared_Snapshot
* Clone
* Fast_Clone

VirtualVolumeUsageTypeEnum.description:
VMware's usage of the vVol. Values are:

* Memory

virtual_volume_detach.description:
Parameters for virtual volume detach. Specify either host id or host group id.
Was added in version 4.1.0.0.

host_id.description: Unique identifier of the host to be detached from the virtual volume. name:{name} can be used instead of {id}. For example: 'host_id':'name:host_name'

host_group_id.description: Unique identifier of the host group to be detached from the virtual volume. name:{name} can be used instead of {id}. For example: 'host_group_id':'name:host_group_name'

force.description:
Normally, attempting to delete a bound virtual volume is not permitted.
This option overrides that error and allows the delete to continue.
Also allows deletion of virtual volume attached to a virtual machine. Normally, a virtual volume attached to
a virtual machine cannot be deleted.

performance_rule_instance.description:
Quality of service rule in a performance policy for policy based management of storage resources.
This resource type has queriable association from policy

id.description: Unique identifier representing a performance rule.

name.description:
Name of the performance rule. 
This property supports case-insensitive filtering.

io_priority_l10n.description: Localized message string corresponding to io_priority

policies.description: List of the policies that are associated with this performance_rule.

io_limit_rule_instance.description:
Properties of an I/O limit rule
The I/O limit rule allows users to specify I/O bandwidth limits.
If both IOP and bandwidth limits are set, both are enforced.

Was added in version 4.0.0.0.
This resource type has queriable association from policy

id.description: Unique identifier of the I/O limit rule.

name.description:
Name of the I/O limit rule. 
This property supports case-insensitive filtering.

max_iops.description:
Maximum I/O operations in either I/O operations per second (IOPS) or I/O operations per second per GB.
The specification of the type attribute determines which measurement is used. If type is set to absolute,
max_iops is specified in IOPS. If type is set to density, max_iops is specified in IOPS per GB.
If both max_iops and max_bw are specified, the system will limit I/O if either value is exceeded.

max_bw.description:
Maximum I/O bandwidth measured in either Kilobytes per second or kilobtyes per second / per GB.
The specification of the type attribute determines which measurement is used. If type is set to absolute,
max_bw is specified in Kilobytes per second. If type is set to density, max_bw is specified in Kilobytes
per second / per GB. If both max_iops and max_bw are specified, the system will limit I/O if either value
is exceeded.

burst_percentage.description:
Percentage indicating by how much the limit may be exceeded. If I/O normally runs below the specified limit, then
the volume or volume group will accumulate burst credits that can be used to exceed the limit for a short period
(a few seconds, but will not exceed the burst limit). This burst percentage applies to both max_iops and max_bw and
is independent of the type setting.

type_l10n.description:
Localized message string corresponding to type
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

policies.description: This is the inverse of the resource type policy association.

io_limit_rule_create.description:
Parameters to an I/O limit rule create operation.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

name.description: Name of the I/O limit rule.

max_iops.description:
Maximum I/O operations in either I/O operations per second (IOPS) or I/O operations per second per GB.
The specification of the type attribute determines which measurement is used. If type is set to absolute,
max_iops is specified in IOPS. If type is set to density, max_iops is specified in IOPS per GB.
If both max_iops and max_bw are specified, the system will limit I/O if either value is exceeded.

max_bw.description:
Maximum I/O bandwidth measured in either Kilobytes per second or kilobtyes per second / per GB.
The specification of the type attribute determines which measurement is used. If type is set to absolute,
max_bw is specified in Kilobytes per second. If type is set to density max_bw is specified in Kilobytes
per second / per GB. If both max_iops and max_bw are specified, the system will limit I/O if either value
is exceeded.

burst_percentage.description:
Percentage indicating by how much the limit may be exceeded. If I/O normally runs below the specified limit, then
the volume or volume_group will accumulate burst credits that can be used to exceed the limit for a short period
(a few seconds, but will not exceed the burst limit). This burst percentage applies to both max_iops and max_bw and
is independent of the type setting.

io_limit_rule_modify.description:
Parameters to an I/O limit rule modify operation.
Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

name.description: New name of the I/O limit rule.

max_iops.description:
New max_iops value. New values for both max_iops and max_bw may be specified, if they are, the system
will limit I/O based upon whatever limit is exceeded first.

max_bw.description:
New max_bw value. New values for both max_iops and max_bw may be specified, if they are, the system
will limit I/O based upon whatever limit is exceeded first.

burst_percentage.description:
Percentage indicating by how much the limit may be exceeded. If I/O normally runs below the specified limit, then
the volume or volume_group will accumulate burst credits that can be used to exceed the limit for a short period
(a few seconds, but will not exceed the burst limit). This burst percentage applies to both max_iops and max_bw and
is independent of the type setting.

BandwidthLimitTypeEnum.description:
This type setting determines how the max_iops and max_bw attributes are used.
* Absolute - Limits are absolute values specified, either I/O operations per second or bandwidth
* Density - Limits specified are per GB, e.g. I/O operations per second per GB

Was added in version 4.0.0.0.

id.description: Unique identifier of the maintenance window.

appliance_id.description: Appliance id on which this maintenance window is configured.

is_enabled.description: Whether the maintenance window is active.

end_time.description: Time when the maintenance window will close (or did close).

appliance.description: This is the embeddable reference form of appliance_id attribute.

maintenance_window_instance.description: This resource type has queriable association from appliance

is_enabled.description: Activate or deactivate the window for one appliance.

end_offset.description:
Number of seconds from the current timestamp the maintenance window will expire.
This value is required if is_enabled is passed as true, and may not exceed the maximum (${maximum} ${x-units}).
The maintenance window can be extended, but not reduced, by setting this while the window is already enabled.

ForecastMetricTypeEnum.description:
Metric type to be forecast. Values are:
* Physical_Space_Used_One_Day

ForecastTimeToFullStatusEnum.description:
Type of alert indicated for object based on projected time to full.
 * OK - Time to full value is greater than 28 days. No alert indicated.
 * Minor - Time to full value is less than or equal to 28 days but greater than 14 days. Minor alert indicated.
 * Major - Time to full value is less than or equal to 14 days. Major alert indicated.
 * None - There is insufficient forecast data to project time to full to at least 28 days. No alert indicated, but available data cannot guarantee `OK` status.

appliance_forecast_response.description: Response for appliance capacity or performance forecast. Response will be just an array of one of the child of this definition.

timestamp.description:
Date-time of the forecast data.
Was deprecated in version 3.0.0.0.

low_value.description:
Estimate for the lower bound forecasted value on that particular time.
Was deprecated in version 3.0.0.0.

mean_value.description:
Estimate for the mean forecasted value on that particular time.
Was deprecated in version 3.0.0.0.

high_value.description:

mean_value.description: Estimate for the mean forecast value at the given timestamp.

high_value.description: Estimate of the upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for the forecast value at the given timestamp.

end_of_forecast.description:
Timestamp of the end of the capacity forecast. If time to full estimates are null, the relevant forecast does not
reach full capacity before it ends.  In this case the end of the forecast can be used as a minimum for time to full.

time_to_full.description: Estimated date-time at which the forecast value will reach full capacity.

time_to_full_pessimistic.description: Pessimistic date-time for time to full based on the upper bound of the forecast 95% confidence interval.

time_to_full_optimistic.description: Optimistic date-time for time to full based on the lower bound of the forecast 95% confidence interval.

time_to_full_status_l10n.description: Localized message string corresponding to time_to_full_status

id.description: Unique ID of recommendation.

created_timestamp.description: Time at which recommendation was created.

estimated_cost.description: Unitless value describing estimated cost to migrate all volumes for this recommendation relative to other recommendations.

type.description:
Type of request that generated a migration recommendation.
Evacuate_Appliance - A recommendation to evacuate space by auto selecting storage objects from an appliance using specified size.

sessions_created_timestamp.description: Time at which migration sessions were created for the recommendation.  Null if migration sessions have not been created.

sessions_completed_timestamp.description:
Time at which all migration sessions for the recommendation were complete. Null if
migration sessions have not been created/started or if any migration pursuant to
the recommendation is still ongoing.

rescan_host_list.description: IDs of hosts that must be rescanned after migration sessions are created but before migration sessions are started.

migration_actions.description: Filtering on the fields of this embedded resource is not supported.

state_l10n.description: Localized message string corresponding to state

type_l10n.description: Localized message string corresponding to type

migration_recommendation_create.description:
Set evacuate_appliance parameters to evacuate space. 
Filtering on the fields of this embedded resource is not supported.

evacuate_appliance.description: Evacuate appliance by specifying optional space_to_free.

appliance_id.description: ID of appliance on which available space is desired.

space_to_free.description:
Optional desired amount of used storage (in bytes) to move to other appliances. If space_to_free is not specified,
space to be freed is estimated by the system such that migrating objects equivalent to that much amount of storage
space would clear Major severity capacity alarm on the appliance. If there is no Major severity capacity alarm on
an appliance and space_to_free is not specified, error will be returned.
To free up desired amount of space from an appliance, specify the amount of space greater than zero to be freed.

target_appliance_ids.description:
Optional IDs of appliances to which used storage can be migrated for this request.
If no target appliances are specified, the evacuated objects can be placed on any appliance in the cluster.

items.description: ID of an appliance.

evacuate_objects.description:
Evacuate appliance by migrating specified storage objects. All specified storage objects must exist on the same source appliance specified by appliance_id.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

appliance_id.description: ID of appliance on which all selected storage objects are located.

target_appliance_ids.description:
Optional IDs of appliances to which used storage can be migrated for this request.
If no target appliances are specified, the evacuated objects can be placed on any appliance in the cluster.

items.description: ID of appliance.

storage_objects.description: A collection of pairs of resource_type and the associated list of volume or volume group family ids or virtual_machine or virtual_volume resource ids. Multiple lists of the same resource type are allowed. Duplicated ids in a single or multiple lists will result in an error.

resource_ids.description: List of resource ids to be evacuated.

items.description: Resource family id.

evacuate_appliance_all.description:
Evacuate all storage objects from an appliance specified by appliance_id.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

appliance_id.description: ID of appliance on which all selected storage objects are located.

target_appliance_ids.description:
Optional IDs of appliances to which used storage can be migrated for this request.
If no target appliances are specified, the evacuated objects can be placed on any appliance in the cluster.

resource_id.description: ID of storage resource migrated by this action.

src_appliance_id.description: ID of appliance that is the source for this migration action.

dst_appliance_id.description: ID of appliance that is the destination for this migration action.

cost.description: Unitless value describing estimated cost to perform relative to other migration actions.

host_connectivity_to_destination.description: Whether all hosts for the migrating resource have connectivity to the destination appliance.

primary_id.description: Unique ID of the primary object.

active.description:
Whether this migration action in active or not. New recommendations will consist entirely of active recommendations but this may be changed with the modify operation.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

connected_appliance_ids.description:
List of appliance ids to which the host attached to this resource has connectivity.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

resource_type_l10n.description: Localized message string corresponding to resource_type

action_state_l10n.description: Localized message string corresponding to action_state

migration_primary_resource_type_l10n.description: Localized message string corresponding to migration_primary_resource_type

migration_reason_l10n.description: Localized message string corresponding to migration_reason

migration_recommendation_action_modify.description:
Migration actions to be modified.
Was added in version 2.0.0.0.

migration_actions.description: List of migration actions to be modified

resource_id.description: Resource ID of migration action to be modified.

dst_appliance_id.description: New dst appliance ID for this migration action.

active.description: New value of the active flag for this migration action. Deactivating an action keeps it in the recommendation, and it can be set active again, until the sessions are created. Inactive actions are skipped when the sessions are created and cannot be set to active after that point.

migration_session_ids.description: ID of migration sessions created for the recommendation.

rescan_host_list.description:
IDs of attached hosts that require a rescan to ensure accessibility of migrated
storage objects after migrations complete.

MigrationRecommendationStateEnum.description:
State of a migration recommendation.
* Recommendation_Created - Recommended actions meet all request parameters.
* Some_Actions_Recommended - Recommendation generated, but not all request parameters satisfied.
* Migration_Session_Created - Migration sessions were successfully created for each recommended migration action.
* Migration_Session_Create_Failed - A migration session could not be created for at least one recommended recommended actions.
  When an error is encountered while creating one of the sessions, the session creation for remaining migration actions will be aborted
  and error is returned. Sessions which are already created for this recommendation will be rolled back.
  After completing the roll-back, recommendation and all actions will be restored to Recommendation_Created state so that
  the recommendation can be applied again.
* Migration_Started - All migration sessions successfully started.
* Migration_Start_Failed - At least one migration session failed to start. Remaining sessions within the recommendation will be attempted,
  Error will be returned.
  There will not be a roll back for any sync operation.
* Migration_Paused - At least one migration session for this recommendation is paused. Paused migration sessions can be resumed manually.
* Migration_Error - At least one migration session for this recommendation has failed.
* Migration_Successful - All migration sessions have been successfully completed.

Values was added in 2.0.0.0: Migration_Start_Failed.

MigrationRecommendationActionStateEnum.description:
State of a recommended migration action.
* Recommendation_Created - This action has been recommended, but no other action has been taken.
* Migration_Session_Created - A migration session was successfully created for this recommended action.
* Migration_Session_Create_Failed - A migration session could not be created for this recommended action.
* Migration_Started - The migration session for this recommended action was successfully started.
* Migration_Start_Failed - The migration session for this recommended action failed to start.
* Migration_Paused - The migration session for this recommended action is paused.
* Migration_Error - The migration session for this recommended action has failed.
* Migration_Successful - The migration session for this recommended action has been successfully completed.

MigrationRecommendationTypeEnum.description:
Type of request that generated a migration recommendation.
* Evacuate_Appliance - A recommendation to evacuate space by auto selecting storage objects from an appliance using specified size.
* Evacuate_Objects - A recommendation to evacuate appliance by using specified objects.

Values was added in 2.0.0.0: Evacuate_Objects.

MigrationRecommendationReasonEnum.description:
Reason for migrating a specific resource.
* No_Host_Attached - Resource is not attached to any host.
* No_Virtual_Machine_Attached - Resource is not attached to any virtual machine.
* Attached_To_Host - Resource is attached to host.
* Attached_To_Virtual_Machine - Resource is attached to virtual machine.
* Virtual_Machine - Resource is virtual machine.
* Virtual_Machine_Family - Resource is virtual machine family
* Replication_Group - Resource is replication group
* Volume_Group_Member - Resource is a member of volume group.
* Unspecified - Unspecified.

Values was added in 3.0.0.0: Virtual_Machine, Replication_Group, Virtual_Machine_Family.

x-display_enum_text.No_Host_Attached: Resource is not attached to any host
x-display_enum_text.No_Virtual_Machine_Attached: Resource is not attached to any virtual machine
x-display_enum_text.Attached_To_Virtual_Machine: Resource is attached to virtual machine
x-display_enum_text.Volume_Group_Member: Resource is a member of volume group

MigrationRecommendationPrimaryResourceTy.description:
Specifies grouping mechanism for migration actions in a recommendation that identifies logically related migration actions.
If a volume/virtual volume is attached to a host/virtual machine and the system selects all volumes/virtual volumes attached
to the same host/virtual machine for migration, the type is set to host/virtual_machine. If a volume/virtual volume is
unattached or the system couldn't consider logical grouping, the group type is set to volume or virtual volume.
For volume group objects, the scope of migration is always volumes_group regardless of host attachment.
The order of selection for primary resource types is:
Resources without host/virtual_machine connectivity.
Resources with host/virtual_machine connectivity.
Resources in each of the above category are further ordered by decreasing cost of migration.

Valid scopes for migrations are:
* volume - Standalone attached/unattached volume family.
* virtual_volume - Standalone attached/unattached virtual volume family.
* host - Logical group of all volume families attached to a host.
* virtual_machine - Logical group of all virtual volume families attached to a virtual machine.
* replication_group - Logical group of all virtual volume families and virtual machines attached to a replication group
* volume_group - Volume group family with or without host attachment.

Values was added in 3.0.0.0: replication_group.

x-display_enum_text.host: Logical group of all volume families attached to a host
x-display_enum_text.virtual_machine: Logical group of all virtual volume families attached to a virtual machine
x-display_enum_text.replication_group: Logical group of all virtual volume families and virtual machines attached to a replication group
x-display_enum_text.volume_group: Volume group family with or without host attachment
